data.name: ActorEntityListToolTip
data.value: Display the list of targetable entities in the area around you. • The list is populated based on distance from the player, and can potentially shift if any entities change positions, including minions.

data.name: ActorRefreshToolTip
data.value: Refresh the selected actor, reloading it based on the changes you've made.

data.name: AnimSpeedToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Animation Speed of the selected actor.

data.name: ArrayOfBytesToolTip
data.value: Contains data about the selected Entity. • You can copy-paste data into this field and hit Apply.

data.name: BodyToolTip
data.value: Changes the Body Type of the selected actor.

data.name: BodyToolTip2
data.value: Allows you to equip any bodypiece on the selected actor.

data.name: BustSizeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Bust Size of the selected actor.

data.name: BustXScaleToolTip
data.value: Modifies the X Scale of the selected actors Bust. • This option is Female only.

data.name: BustYScaleToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Y Scale of the selected actors Bust. • This option is Female only.

data.name: BustZScaleToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Z Scale of the selected actors Bust. • This option is Female only.

data.name: CamSettingsLoadToolTip
data.value: Load camera settings from file. • Hold ALT to rotate Cam Angle X relative to the target. • Try jiggling the camera or loading again if the camera is blocked by an object and didn't restore completely.

data.name: ClanToolTip
data.value: Changes the Clan of the selected actor.

data.name: DataPathToolTip
data.value: Changes the Data Path of the selected entity. •This will allow you use the animations of other Races or Genders. • Does not require an Actor Refresh, and can be used in and out of GPose. • The entity's skeleton will be morphed to fit the selected race. This stretching or shrinking is unavoidable. • You can use Actor Refresh if you want to become an abomination for fun.

data.name: DrenchedToolTip
data.value: Gives the selected entity a much more pronounced wetness effect. • Same as Wet, this effect goes away over time.

data.name: EarMuscleTailSizeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Ear, Muscle, and Tail Size of the selected actor.

data.name: EarsToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any earrings on the selected actor.

data.name: EarTailScaleToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Ear and Tail Scale of the selected actor.

data.name: EarTailTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Ear and Tail of the selected actor.

data.name: EntityTypeToolTip
data.value: For Advanced Users Only! • This will change the Entity type of the selected entity. • This can lead to unpredictable and unwanted behavior for some entities. • Changing some NPCs to Type 1 will allow them to be targetable in GPose.

data.name: EyeBrowsToolTip
data.value: Changes the Eyebrows Type of the selected actor.

data.name: EyeColorLeftToolTip
data.value: Changes the Left Eye Color of the selected actor.

data.name: EyeColorRightToolTip
data.value: Changes the Right Eye Color of the selected actor.

data.name: EyeTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Eyes Type of the selected actor.

data.name: FacePaintColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the Face Paint Color of the selected actor.

data.name: FacePaintToolTip
data.value: Changes the Face Paint and Tattoos of the selected actor.

data.name: FacialFeaturesToolTip
data.value: Changes the Facial Features of the selected actor.

data.name: FeetToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any footwear on the selected actor.

data.name: FindProcessToolTip
data.value: Reload the Final Fantasy XIV process.

data.name: ForceAnimToolTip
data.value: Forces the selected entity to perform an animation. • This can only be used in GPose. • In order to use this, you need to do a non-looping emote, suchs as /wave before entering GPose. • Some animations have a specific race/gender requirement in order to perform. You may need to use a different Data Path if your character is just twitching. • Does not work on NPCs!

data.name: FreeCompanyToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Free Company Tag of the selected actor.

data.name: FreezePosToolTip
data.value: Freezes the position of the selected entity • This is useful for moving entities in GPose, as it will prevent them from snapping back to their original position when their emote changes or you use face camera. • Make sure to press this button again before clicking or tabbing to a new entity, or it will snap them to the same position.

data.name: FreezeRotToolTip
data.value: Freezes the rotation of the selected entity. • This is useful in conjunction with Freeze Pos for preserving the position and rotation of an entity in GPose. • You can use this along with the 'Face Camera' toggle in-game (Default: Space Bar) to turn the entity's head without turning the entire body. • Same as Freeze Pos, make sure to toggle off Freeze Rot before switching entities in GPose. • Required for using Numerical direct input or Rotation Sliders.

data.name: GenderToolTip
data.value: Changes the Gender of the selected actor.

data.name: GposeModeToolTip
data.value: Allows for certain values such as XYZ Position, Rotation and Animation to be changed for your currently selected entity in GPose. • GPose mode and Target Mode both toggle on at the same time. Make sure not to have Target Mode already toggled on, or it will toggle off instead.

data.name: GposeViewSettingsLoadToolTip
data.value: Load GPose View position from file. • Hold CTRL to load relative to the current actor position. • Hold ALT to load and rotate relative to current actor position & rotation. • You can load saved actor positionss to jump GPose View actor to that position.

data.name: GposeViewSettingsSaveToolTip
data.value: Save GPose View position to file.

data.name: HairColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the Hair Color of the selected actor.

data.name: HairStyleToolTip
data.value: Changes the Hairstyle of the selected actor.

data.name: HandsToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any handwear on the selected actor.

data.name: HeadToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any headpiece on the selected actor.

data.name: HeadTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Head Type of the selected actor.

data.name: HeightToolTip
data.value: Changes the Height of the selected actor.

data.name: HighLightButtonToolTip
data.value: Toggles Highlights for the selected actor.

data.name: HighlightsToolTip
data.value: Changes the Highlights Color of the selected actor.

data.name: IdleAnimToolTip
data.value: Changes the Idle Animation of the selected entity. • This can be used both in and out of GPose. • If you plan to use this in GPose, you will need to sit/stand, then use /cpose until your Idle Anim reads. • This can be used on Pets, Minions, Chocobos and most NPCs!

data.name: JawTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Jaw Type of the selected actor.

data.name: JobIconToolTip
data.value: Changes the Job Icon of the selected party member in your party list.

data.name: LeftRingToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any ring on the selected actors left hand.

data.name: LegsToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any leggings on the selected actor.

data.name: LimbalOrTattooToolTip
data.value: Changes the Limbal Ring and Tattoo Color of the selected actor.

data.name: LinkPositionToolTip
data.value: Toggles linking for this actor. • Changing position or rotation of any linked actor will affect them all. • Turn this on for all actors you want to move together!

data.name: LipColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the Lips Color and Fur Pattern of the selected actor.

data.name: LoadMainWindowToolTip
data.value: Load Appearance from a user-generated JSON file. •You can load data you have saved from the Character Creator in-game using the 'Load .DAT' option.

data.name: LockFacialAnimationToolTip
data.value: Locks the Facial Animation of the selected actor. • To properly lock the facial animation of the selected actor, you need to toggle this on, freeze the option, and then set Anim Speed to Zero.

data.name: MainHandScaleToolTip
data.value: Controls the XYZ Scale of the entity's main hand weapon. • This can be used to resize main hand props as well, but does not affect the size of 'vfx items' that appear temporarily during certain emotes, such as the Tomestone.

data.name: MainHandToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any weapon on the selected actor. • If you want their hands to be empty, either equip the 'Emperor's New Fists', or use Main Hand Scale and/or Off Hand Scale in the Right Pane.

data.name: ModelTypeButtonToolTip
data.value: Opens a flyout menu on the right side that allows you to search for Monsters, Demi-Humans, Prop Entities and Entity-Based Effects. • Some NPCs are found under this selection because they are classified as Demi-Humans, such as Beast Tribes, Zenos, Thordan/Knights, etc. • If you become invisible after changing to a Demi-Human, change all of your Equipment to Base 0, Variant 0. If this doesn't work, try 1,0 or 1,1.

data.name: ModelTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Model Type of the selected actor.

data.name: MouthTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Mouth Type of the selected actor.

data.name: MuscleToneToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Muscle Tone of the selected actor.

data.name: NameToolTip
data.value: Modifies the display name of the selected actor.

data.name: NeckToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any necklace on the selected actor.

data.name: NoseTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Nose Type of the selected actor.

data.name: NPCOutfitToolTip
data.value: Opens a fly-out search window on the right that allows you to search for NPCs by name. • You will need to use Actor Refresh after clicking an entry to assume their appearance. • Some NPCs, such as beast tribes, Zenos and a few others are not in this section because they are classified as Demi-Humans. They can be found by searching Model Type on the first tab.

data.name: OffHandScaleToolTip
data.value: Controls the XYZ Scale of the entity's off hand weapon. • This affects equipment such as a Shield, Quiver, Aetherpack, Sleeve, Katana Sheath, Focus and Left Hand Dagger or Fist.

data.name: OffHandToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip an off hand weapon. •In order to find an applicable off hand (except for shields), you need to search for the main hand equipment using the off hand 'View' button. For example to find a Sheath or Quiver, you need to search for the Katana or Bow that goes with it.

data.name: OverallScaleToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Overall Scale of the selected actor.

data.name: PosSettingsLoadToolTip
data.value: Load actor position from file. • Hold CTRL to load relative to current GPose View. • Hold ALT to load and rotate relative to current GPose View & cam angle. • You can load saved GPose View positions to jump an actor to that position. • Visible position is affected by emote animations! Use the same neutral emote when loading and saving for best results.

data.name: PosSettingsSaveToolTip
data.value: Save actor position to file. • Visible position is affected by emote animations! Use the same neutral emote when loading and saving for best results.

data.name: RaceToolTip
data.value: Changes the Race of the selected actor.

data.name: RealTimeRotationToolTip
data.value: Use your mouse buttons to control the cube. • All rotations are relative to the direction that the entity is currently facing. • RMB controls X-axis rotation. • LMB controls Y-axis rotation. • MMB controls Z-axis rotation.

data.name: RelativeXYZPosToolTip
data.value: This toggle will make all XYZ movements relative to the entity being targeted, and not absolute based on the gameworld. • This setting is defaulted to on, and its state is saved between sessions.

data.name: RelativeXYZRotToolTip
data.value: This toggle will make all XYZ rotations relative to the entity being targeted, and not absolute based on the gameworld. • This setting is defaulted to on, and its state is saved between sessions. • Only affects the Realtime Rotation Cube.

data.name: RightRingToolTip
data.value: Allows you to equip any ring on the selected actors right hand.

data.name: RotationSlidersToolTip
data.value: This toggle will switch between Rotation Sliders and Numerical direct input. •This setting is defaulted to on, and its state is saved between sessions. • Turning it off will turn the XYZ Rotation sliders into numerical values. • Each input will accept a value between 0 and 360. • Both Rotation Sliders and Numerical direct input require Rotation to be frozen.

data.name: SaveMainWindowToolTip
data.value: Save Appearance to a JSON file.

data.name: SavePointToolTip
data.value: Creates a 'Backup' state that you can load later.

data.name: SkinToneToolTip
data.value: Changes the Skintone of the selected actor.

data.name: StatusEffectToolTip
data.value: Allows you to apply non-standard status VFX to entities in GPose. 1. Activate one of the basic Statuses in the GPose menu (Such as Pyretic) 2. Select the new VFX you want from the drop-down menu. 3. Remove the Status you selected using the GPose menu. • To choose a new effect or remove the current one, hit Reset or overwrite it with another Status (Such as Deep Freeze).

data.name: TargetModeToolTip
data.value: Allows you to change values for your selected target without using the Entity List. •This is handy for busy areas where the Entity List constantly shifting. You will need to uncheck this and use the normal method to apply the changes you make, though.

data.name: TimeControlToolTip
data.value: Adjusts the current time for the zone. • Using Time Control while in GPose with 'Freeze Time/Weather' toggled on will cycle the phases of the Moon.

data.name: TimeLockToolTip
data.value: Attempts to prevent the time set using Time Control from changing. •This is imprecise, and will still shift slightly over long periods of time.

data.name: TitleToolTip
data.value: Changes the Title of the selected actor.

data.name: TransparencyToolTip
data.value: Modifies the transparency of the selected entity. • Reducing the transparency of an actor does not affect their main or offhand weapons. You can set the XYZ scale of their weapons to 0 in the Equipment tab. • Setting this to 0 for an entity in GPose can cause the system to forget that they're targetable. If you plan to still use them, set it to 0.03.

data.name: VoiceTypeToolTip
data.value: Changes the Voice Type of the selected actor.

data.name: WeatherForceToolTip
data.value: Controls the current weather for your zone. •This method uses instant transitions, and will change as soon as you select a weather from the drop down menu.

data.name: WeatherToolTip
data.value: Controls the current weather for your zone. •This method uses natural transitions and may a bit of time to take effect.

data.name: WetToolTip
data.value: Gives the target entity the effect that you get from being in water, or in rain. • This effect will wear off over time if toggled off.

data.name: WristsToolTIp
data.value: Allows you to equip any bracelet on the selected actor.

data.name: XPosToolTip
data.value: Modifies the X Position of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose.

data.name: XRot2ToolTip
data.value: Modifies the X Rotation of the selected joint.

data.name: XRotToolTip
data.value: Modifies the X Rotation of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose. • Both Rotation Sliders and Numerical direct input require Rotation to be frozen.

data.name: YPosToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Y Position of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose.

data.name: YRot2ToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Y Rotation of the selected joint.

data.name: YRotToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Y Rotation of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose. • Both Rotation Sliders and Numerical direct input require Rotation to be frozen.

data.name: ZeroScaleToolTip
data.value: Sets the XYZ Scale to 0, effectively rendering it invisible. • You can undo this by inputing '1.0' in each of the fields.

data.name: ZPosToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Z Position of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose.

data.name: ZRot2ToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Z Rotation of the selected joint.

data.name: ZRotToolTip
data.value: Modifies the Z Rotation of the selected actor. • You may need to Freeze the animations of your actor to properly apply this in GPose. • Both Rotation Sliders and Numerical direct input require Rotation to be frozen.
